newsitem.title: INDIA: India steel demand to rise to 38.68 mlnT by 2001/2.
newsitem.headline: India steel demand to rise to 38.68 mlnT by 2001/2.

text.p: India's steel demand is expected to rise to 38.68 million tonnes by 2001/2 (April-March) from 24.72 million tonnes in 1997/98, a Steel Ministry statement said on Thursday.

The statement quoted a report of the working group for the ninth five-year-plan (1997-2002) as saying that steel output would rise to 38.01 million tonnes by 2001/2 from the current 23.84 million tonnes.
"This will leave a gap of only 0.67 million tonnes," the statement said.
It said that by the turn of the century India would be able to substantially lower its annual steel imports from the current 1.5 million tonnes.
"The increase in production is expected from modernisation and expansion of existing integrated steel plants and creation of new capacities in the private sector," the statement said.
